comments.commentBody: Think of the aerial shots!  I hope that was in jest.  The camera work for the Winter Classic was awful. Only the replays gave any indication of where the puck was, let alone the excitement of the game. Did we really see any Varlomov saves?  I didn't.

We often read of records for youngsters achieving the GM title. Is there any record for an older
player gaining the title? Highest age to acquire the title, etc.
LRH

It took me forever to learn that the slang was THAT'S WACK and far more condemning an assessment than amusingly peculiar. For that, I thought myself Livengood and very hep.

Welcome, Deb. I know your commentary won't disappoint.
Aha! You are doing sage. I'm doing parsley, rosemary, and thyme. Look forward to greeting you in the am.

Query:

What playoff teams did the Giants beat this year?

Da Bears......otherwise Phila. 0-2, Colts 0-1 Packers 0-1

oh wait the MIghty Mighty SeaSlugs.

Victories over teams with winning records?

Jax, Bears........

Coughlin, EllieMay, Mediocrity.
Does this mean GS employees can now log on from the office?

Smells like the year 2000 all over again.  Do you remember Napster and the other Internet bubble companies?  What are they worth now?  Remember when MySpace was a big deal?  Facebook is a passing fad with no product or any true ground breaking technology.  $50 billion hype = hold on to your wallets.
Oh great, another Internet bubble.

comments.userLocation: alaska, where I can see Sarah Palin's backyard
comments.commentBody: Duh, Goldman's just buying a bulk of facebook shares, cutting it into pieces to sell it to their clients at a profit. Likely they'd keep no piece of the risk to themselves.

Can Facebook eradicate malaria, generate clean sustainable energy, cure alzheimer's , raise the math and reading priciencies of our children's brains, build earthquake homes and purify drinking water in Haiti?
Our government bailed out Goldman Sachs so it could speculate on this digital narcissism ? How is this going to strengthen our country? How will this make a better future for ALL children, and not just the few who will inherit these billions?

"Even as Goldman takes a stake in Facebook, its employees may struggle to view what they invested in. Like those at most major Wall Street firms, Goldman’s computers automatically block access to social networking sites, including Facebook."

ugh Iphone, blackerry, android, windows mobile.....

It's not a huge amount of money for Goldman. What I'm waiting for is for Facebook to make a real contribution to humanity--like Google books or Google language tools. So far all I see are a bunch of time wasters.

What another sad commentary on modern American life. So Facebook is worth $50 billion? They dont make anything. They dont do anything. They arent anything but a website providing a forum for persons to send inane messages to each other about tieing their shoes, hanging out their laundry to dry,., eating Thai food a the best Thai restaurant. What have we become? A nation of message mongers. Why spend your time on Facebook, which is appropriately named, when you could be out talking to real human beings? When you could out teaching yourself a useful skill or ability. Why waste all that time flirting with each other for no apparent purpose except the vicarious thrill of talking to a new person without ever meeting them. What the hell is the matter with this country. No wonder we are 15 in math and 17 in science in worldwide competition. We are aimless entertainment seeking missles who dont have the foggiest idea why we waste so many hours on Facebook. We've become a thrill seeking nation of voyeurs. Say it loud, I am a voyeur and I am proud. China takes over while we flirt with a new person. What a demise for a once great nation.
Another reason to stop using Facebook.  We want our economy back, Goldman.

The Maras always keep coaches at least one season too long. It is clear that Coughlin and his grou of coaches are not the crew to take us back to glory. They caught lightning in a bottle  for the one Super Bowl. The fact that they haven't gotten into post season since tells you it was a flukey. It also goes to show how important Strahan was to that team. He could light a fire under them. The Maras will be criminal if they don't line things up for Spagnuolo to succeed Coughlin after next season.
With tech-clueless Goldman Sachs throwing away its money, I now know for sure that Facebook is a passing fad.
cut spending- kill the economy- Hallalujah!

I seem to remember the debt starting around 2001. And continuing apace for the entire Bush administration. Now, in your defense, you can point to the dot-com bust and the recession at the beginning of that decade. But that does not justify continued deficits beyond 2003. You seem to have learned the feel-good part of Reagan without remembering he also raised taxes many times to shrink huge deficits down to merely large deficits.

So, no, I don't think the rapid run-up of debt over the last two years is as disconcerting as that over the last 10. When the Republican Party relearns that fiscal responsibility sometimes requires raising taxes (or even closing loopholes that are harmful to Americans and domestic businesses), then we can talk.
Sounds about right.

I mean . . . of course a person from the Claremont Institute would imply that the government should not be compassionate to the people who entrust it to be responsible, just, and equitable.

I'd say a middle of the road solution would recognize the serious budget and pension problems in the several states and provide stimulus funds contingent on those states undergoing an audit, converting to commonly accepted accounting standards, and renegotiating some contracts--all under a framework that results in positive cash flow by 2013 and sovlency through 2040.

I expect Social Security to be atacked.  Everyone should realize that payroll taxes which fund Social Security have been used for other purposes and Social Security is not part of the deficit problem.  At least it hasn't been part of the problem until payroll taxes were reduced by 2% to give tax breaks to millionaires and billionaires.

Hot air. That is what we will get from the House. A lot of hot air. Our fore-fathers were brilliant in their structure of the government. Without the Senate, and, most important, the President, the House can talk, talk, talk (for two years) and get no where. Who'se afraid of the big bad wolf? Not the Senate or the President, both of which have shotguns.

So we get either a: a government shutdown, or b: the elimination of the mandate and Obamacare falling to pieces. What's not to like ?

I'll take either of the two, at a black-market price, right now.

Bring it, lefties !
stop beach replenishment projects that spend billions of dollars protecting the homes of fools who build their mansions on eroding beaches while global warming is raising the sealevel.

Viable bike roads could be built in some places on side streets that parallel the main road. Many of those side streets are not viable right now only because they contain numerous stop signs --- that was the intention, in order to cut down on auto traffic through neighborhood streets.

Those intersections could be retrofitted with two-way stop signs in one direction, and two-way car-only stop signs in the other direction. This would create an efficient side route for bike traffic without opening up neighborhood streets to through car traffic.
